intro: Macleania glabra, commonly known as the smooth macleania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and Georgia, where it thrives in moist, acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often found in wetlands and coastal areas.
